text:
When I set LogLevel to debug, debug level log messages from mod_ldap are going
to stdout rather than my ErrorLog.
creator: stuff-1-apache@carlini.com

text:
are these messages at startup, perhaps while parsing the config?  such log
messages are meant to go to the terminal until the error log has been properly
set up; there is no error log yet to write them to
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
They are at startup, but this is the only module which sends them to stdout. All
others end up in the ErrorLog. This isn't to say you're wrong, just that it's
awfully odd that this occurs only for this one module. If true, perhaps these
could be buffered and output delayed until after the Error is set up?
creator: stuff-1-apache@carlini.com
minfrin@sharp.fm
text:
The LDAP module is very noisy when it starts up in debug mode, as it outputs a
whole lot of debug information on startup, unlike most of the other apache
modules which don't output anything at all.

If these messages are not going to the log after startup, then this would be a
problem.
